org.nodes

Interface DTGraph<L,T>

  • Type Parameters:
    L -
    T -
    All Superinterfaces:
    DGraph<L>, Graph<L>, TGraph<L,T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LightDTGraph, MapDTGraph

    public interface DTGraph<L,T>
extends DGraph<L>, TGraph<L,T>
    A directed graph with both nodes and links labeled. The labels of graph links are called tags. TGraph is short for Tagged Graph
    Author:
    Peter

      • connected

        boolean connected(L from,
                L to)
        Checks whether two nodes exist with the given labels that are connected. If multiple pairs of nodes exist with these labels, only one of them needs to be connected for the method to return true.
        Specified by:
        connected in interface DGraph<L>
        Specified by:

      • state

        long state()
        The state of a graph indicates whether it has changed. If the value returned by this method has changed, then a modification has been made. If the value is the same, then with great likelihood, the graph has not been modified.
        Specified by:
        state in interface DGraph<L>
        Specified by:
